content: rectangular shell blanket design by mbdesign october 2016 lisserbroek the netherlands © this rectangular shells pattern is based on the beautiful shells blanket by lahoma nally-kaye ​ videotutorial crochet - mbdesign https //www facebook com/mbdesign 9/ fref=ts ​ i made this rectangular version for kathleen abbreviations slip_stitch slipstitch single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet v_stitch 1 double_crochet chain 1 1 double_crochet corner 1 v_stitch chain 3 1 v_stitch in single_crochet shell corner 5 double_crochet in chain 1 space 1 single_crochet in chain 3 space 5 double_crochet in chain 1 space change colors in the beginning of a new row it s fun lets begin starting row chain 20 turn chain 1 row 2 1 single_crochet in every stitch of the starting row 20 stitches row 3 1 slip_stitch in middle of the chainrow this will be the first shell chain 3 4 double_crochet in the same stitch slip_stitch in first single_crochet chain 3 4 double_crochet in same stitch second shell © skip 2 single_crochet 1 single_crochet in 3rd single_crochet skip 2 single_crochet make a shell in 3rd single_crochet 5 double_crochet skip 2 single_crochet 1 single_crochet in 3rd single_crochet skip 2 single_crochet make a shell in 3rd single_crochet 5 double_crochet skip 2 single_crochet 1 single_crochet in 3rd single_crochet skip 2 make a shell in last single_crochet close with a slip_stitch 1 slip_stitch in the middle space between the single_crochet row chain 3 4 double_crochet shell 1 slip_stitch in this same stitch 1 slip_stitch in the next single_crochet chain 3 4 double_crochet shell 1 slip_stitch in this same stitch skip 1 single_crochet 1 single_crochet in next single_crochet skip 2 single_crochet make a shell in 3rd single_crochet 5 double_crochet in the same stitch as on the opposite side repeat the instructions from the other side end with a shell in the last single_crochet in this row close with a slip_stitch fasten_off row 4 v-stitches and chains cast on in the first single_crochet before your last shell that you made 1 slip_stitch chain 4 1 double_crochet counts as 1 v_stitch chain 5 this is going to be the first corner 1 v_stitch chain 3 1 v_stitch in the slip_stitch in between the shells chain 5 1 v_stitch chain 3 1 v_stitch in the slip_stitch in between the shells this is going to be the 2nd corner chain 5 v_stitch in single_crochet chain 5 v_stitch in single_crochet chain 5 the next one is going to be the 3rd corner 1 v_stitch chain 3 1 v_stitch in the slip_stitch in between the shells © chain 5 the next one is the 4th and last corner 1 v_stitch chain 3 1 v_stitch in the slip_stitch in between the shells repeat the instructions from the opposite side close this row with 1 slip_stitch in the first v_stitch in this row row 5 shells cast on in the v_stitch where you ended your last row slip_stitch chain 3 4 double_crochet shell all in the same v_stitch 1 single_crochet in the 3rd double_crochet from 2 row below corner shell 5 double_crochet in
